title: Run a DApp
summary: This tutorial shows you how to run a Reach Hello World decentralized application in a POSIX-compliant shell.

title: Set up an IDE
summary: This tutorial shows you how to set up a Reach development environment for Mac, Linux, or Windows PC.

title: Wisdom for Sale
summary: This tutorial shows you how to build Wisdom for Sale, a command-line and web-based application that enables two participants, a seller and a buyer, to trade wisdom for tokens via a smart contract running on a private Algorand, Ethereum, or Conflux consensus network residing in a Docker container on your computer.

title: Market Day
summary: This tutorial builds upon Wisdom for Sale by demonstrating how to use a variety of data types (string, integer, boolean, object, and array) in interact objects.

title: Rock Paper Scissors
summary: Focusing on the Reach programming language itself, this tutorial helps you build a game in which two participants play Rock, Paper, Scissors.

title: How to sponsor a Reach contract on Conflux
summary: This article shows you how to pay the gas and storage fees on behalf of participants that visit a Reach smart contract deployed on the Conflux MainNet or TestNet.
author: Ivan Lin

title: How do network and non-network tokens differ?
summary: This article explains how network and non-network tokens differ, and why it is important.
author: Jay McCarthy

title: What do the different consensus transfers mean?
summary: This article describes various ways that Reach applications transition from local steps to consensus steps.
author: Jay McCarthy
